commitResults.messageBody:
Duke Chatbot template with no features

Let's
* Rename Chatbot from Duke to KwunBot
* Implement greeting
* Implement bye statement

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Implement actions on user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Skeletal version with simple greeting and bye

Let's
* Echo commands entered by user
* Exit with bye statement when user inputs 'bye'

Chatbot can echo user inputs

Let's
* Add the ability to store tasks in list
* Implement 'list' command to show current list of tasks stored

Chatbot can store tasks in list

Let's
* Add Task class to represent a task in the list
* Add the ability to mark task as done or undone
* Allow user to see checklist

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Implement 3 specific types of task: ToDos, Deadlines, Events
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot handles all tasks the same way.

Provide specific support for the 3 different types of tasks.
Creating 3 subclasses for each type of task allows us to use
polymorphism when dealing with tasks.

Let's
* Add 'Todo', 'Deadline', 'Event' classes to represent the respective task
* Pull up behaviours common to all tasks classes into the parent 'Task' class
* Make 'Task' class an abstract class

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: No line found by Scanner
commitResults.messageBody:
An infinite while loop to scan user inputs

NoSuchElementException: No line found at Scanner.nextLine

Let's replace while true to while Scanner hasNextLine()

To check if there is a next line before scanning.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Implement Automated Text UI Testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Manually testing Chatbot.

Use I/O redirection technique to semi-automate testing.

Let's
* Create text-ui-test folder
* Add runtest.bat (Windows)
* Add input.txt and EXPECTED.txt for testing

Chatbot did not handle errors and threw exceptions.

Create Exceptions classes to handle errors.

Let's
* Create abstract class DukeException
* Create subclasses to handle specific errors
* Handle errors by catching them and outputing appropriate response

Chatbot not able to delete task.

Use ArrayList to store tasks and allow task deletion.

Let's
* Create use ArrayList to store tasks
* Implement delete command
* Handle possible errors with delete command

Uppercase input would produce wrong response.

Let's use toLowerCase() to make the command lowercased.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: Text UI Testing input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT
commitResults.messageBody:
Expected result was incorrect due to changes made in Chatbot.

Let's edit EXPECTED.TXT and change input.txt to incorporate new features.

Command types are constants so using Enums makes sense.

Let's create CommandType enum and use switch statement to check for
corresponding values.

Chatbot was not exiting upon 'bye' command

Let's implement a shouldBreak variable and an if statement to break out of while loop.

Chatbot would lose data upon restart.

Create tasks file to store data and load data when chatbot starts up.

Let's
* Use File access to read file
* Use File access to write to file
* Handle errors regarding file access

Chatbot did not understand dates and times.

Use java.time.LocalDateTime.

Let's
* Accept datetimes in dd/MM/yyyy HHmm format
* Print dates in a different format
* Handle erros pertaining to wrong date format inputted

Code was repetitive and mostly in one file.

Extract out closely related code.

Let's
* Extract Ui, Storage, Parser, TaskList classes
* Created abstract Command classes and more *Command classes
* Handled more exceptions

Code was messy.

Divide classes into packages.

Let's create duke duke.task, duke.command, duke.exception packages.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Automate project builds using Gradle
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's
* Merge add-gradle-support branch from origin to master branch
* Edit build.gradle and set mainClass to 'duke.Duke'
